title: Grilled Asian Chicken Recipe
description: Asian chicken flavored with a delicious combo of soy, sesame, ginger, garlic, and honey. The marinade creates a delicious glaze on grilled chicken.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes BBQ & Grilling Chicken Chicken Breast Grilled Asian Chicken 4.5 (552) 416 Reviews 30 Photos Delicious Asian chicken with a sweet-savory glaze. This recipe is great for last-minute company or a quick dinner by rounding it out with a baked potato and tossed salad. Submitted by Janet M Leichliter Updated on April 3, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 30 30 30 30 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Additional Time: 15 mins Total Time: 45 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings ¼ cup soy sauce 2 tablespoons honey 4 teaspoons sesame oil 2 cloves garlic, crushed 3 slices fresh ginger root 4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Combine soy sauce, honey, sesame oil, garlic, and ginger in a small microwave-safe bowl; heat in the microwave on medium power for 1 minute, then stir. Heat again for 30 seconds, watching closely to prevent boiling. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place chicken breasts in a shallow dish. Pour soy sauce mixture over top and set aside to marinate for 15 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate. Meanwhile, remove chicken from marinade; transfer marinade into a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until thick, about 1 minute. Set aside for basting. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook chicken on the preheated grill, basting frequently with reserved marinade, until golden brown on all sides and chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 6 to 8 minutes per side. An instant-read meat thermometer inserted into the thickest piece should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Editor's Note: The nutrition data for this recipe includes information for the full amount of the marinade ingredients. Depending on marinating time, ingredients, cooking method, etc., the actual amount of the marinade consumed will vary. I Made It Print 677 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 217 Calories 8g Fat 11g Carbs 26g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 217 % Daily Value * Total Fat 8g 10% Saturated Fat 2g 8% Cholesterol 67mg 22% Sodium 961mg 42% Total Carbohydrate 11g 4% Dietary Fiber 0g 1% Total Sugars 9g Protein 26g 51% Vitamin C 1mg 1% Calcium 19mg 1% Iron 1mg 7% Potassium 255mg 5% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Grilled Asian Chicken 01 of 30 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 30 Photo by  Nigel Kirk 02/22/2024 Great flavors A keeper! Easy to follow 03 of 30 Photo by  Maria Sauserman 03/02/2020 I didn’t have breasts so I made it with chicken thighs… no other changes!!!! Absolutely delicious! Thank you! 04 of 30 Photo by  Sue Anthony Crowder 03/24/2019 Love this marinade! Perfect for a quick weekday dinner with rice and a salad. Only thing I did differently was to blend the marinade to help intensify the ginger garlic flavor. Sometimes add Sambal to add a little kick. 05 of 30 Photo by  Sue Anthony Crowder 03/24/2019 Love this marinade! Perfect for a quick weekday dinner with rice and a salad. Only thing I did differently was to blend the marinade to help intensify the ginger garlic flavor. Sometimes add Sambal to add a little kick. 06 of 30 Photo by  Dustin Byington 02/28/2019 07 of 30 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02/26/2018 Terrific chicken! I minced the ginger instead of adding then removing slices. I marinated the chicken in the fridge for a couple of hours then baked it in the sauce turning halfway through the cooking. #AllrecipesAllstarsCanada #lunarnewyear 08 of 30 Photo by  Chef V 02/07/2018 This is okay. As written the marinating time really does nothing. It was missing something to me...not exactly sure what. I recommend marinating for at least 4 or 6 hours. 09 of 30 Photo by  Ruby 01/31/2018 10 of 30 Photo by  Sandi Lehr 11/06/2017 I thought this was outstanding. I followed the marianade ingredients exactly, however, placed chicken in the marinade for a couple of hours instead of the 10 minutes. This chicken was heavenly. I served with Asian noodles posted by another member on this site. 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Asian Chicken Salad 630 Ratings Easy Grilled Teriyaki Chicken 466 Ratings Hawaiian Chicken Pineapple Kabobs 798 Ratings Chinese Chicken Salad 55 Ratings Chili-Lime Chicken Kabobs 1,008 Ratings Grilled Chicken Salad with Seasonal Fruit 267 Ratings Chicken Satay 574 Ratings Grilled Lemon Chicken 584 Ratings Singapore Satay 19 Ratings Caribbean Chicken Salad 176 Ratings Reshmi Kebab (Silken Kebabs) 20 Ratings Kabobs 280 Ratings Sesame Pasta Chicken Salad 1,353 Ratings RamJam Chicken 390 Ratings Almond Chicken Salad 128 Ratings Spicy Chicken Breasts 704 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
